title: Prefigurative Community Building (Part 26): Growing Community Health Collectives - A Power With Guide to Peer-Led Healing
summary: Reclaim health as a collective practice through peer-organized healing networks that center traditional knowledge, mutual aid, and accessible care.

Community.summary: Build peer-led health collectives that reclaim healing as shared community practice rather than commodity.

level0: Host conversations about community health needs and existing care skills
Start sharing herbal knowledge and simple remedies with neighbors
Organize peer support circles or listening sessions
level1: Form a small health collective with shared agreements and values
Host regular skillshares on somatic tools, herbs, and peer support
Organize one free community clinic or health fair
level2: Develop rotating coordination roles and accessible infrastructure
Build community apothecary and peer skill library
Connect with other health collectives for knowledge sharing
level3: Support formation of additional autonomous health collectives
Build lasting infrastructure for peer-led healing networks

Knowledge.summary: Develop and share traditional healing knowledge, peer support skills, and health justice practices.

resources.label: Harm Reduction Guide to Coming Off Psychiatric Drugs

level0: Learn about traditional healing practices and herbal medicine
Study successful health collectives like Fireweed and Solidarity Apothecary
level1: Practice peer support and trauma-informed care approaches
Document traditional healing knowledge and community health practices
level2: Host workshops on starting health collectives and peer support groups
Create zines and resources about accessible community health
level3: Develop comprehensive community health organizing toolkits
Research and document impacts of peer-led vs institutional health care

Narrative.summary: Challenge medical hierarchy narratives and promote stories of community-controlled healing.

level0: Share stories of successful peer-led healing and community health
Challenge narratives that medicalize all health concerns
level1: Advocate for community-controlled rather than institutional health approaches
Write and share experiences of collective healing practices
level2: Lead community discussions about reclaiming health as commons
Create media highlighting traditional knowledge and peer support successes
level3: Contribute to cultural shift toward viewing community health as normal
Mentor others in articulating visions of healing justice and health sovereignty
